entries.name: Zlib::GzipReader.new(io, options = {})click to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a GzipReader object associated with io. The GzipReader object reads gzipped data from io, and parses/decompresses it.  The io must have a read method that behaves same as the IO#read.

entries.name: Zlib::GzipReader.open(filename) {|gz| ... }click to toggle source
entries.desc: Opens a file specified by filename as a gzipped file, and returns a GzipReader object associated with that file.  Further details of this method are in ::new and ZLib::GzipFile.wrap.

entries.desc: This is a deprecated alias for each_byte.

entries.name: readpartial(maxlen [, outbuf]) => string, outbufclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Reads at most maxlen bytes from the gziped stream but it blocks only if gzipreader has no data immediately available. If the optional outbuf argument is present, it must reference a String, which will receive the data. It raises EOFError on end of file.

entries.name: rewind()
entries.desc: Resets the position of the file pointer to the point created the GzipReader object.  The associated IO object needs to respond to the seek method.

entries.name: tell()
entries.desc: Total number of output bytes output so far.

entries.desc: See Zlib::GzipReader documentation for a description.

entries.name: ungetc(p1)
entries.desc: See Zlib::GzipReader documentation for a description.

entries.name: unused()
entries.desc: Returns the rest of the data which had read for parsing gzip format, or nil if the whole gzip file is not parsed yet.
